definition: hibernation/living in seclusion
to hibernate
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
surname Fu

sentences.english: Her feelings of affection are dormant but easily awakened.
sentences.chinese: 她的钟爱之情蛰伏着但很容易被唤醒。

sentences.english: But light struggled with dark in Nixon's soul.
sentences.chinese: 然而，光明与黑暗的对决却蛰伏于他的内心深处。

sentences.english: We stay in the room, door closed, lights out.
sentences.chinese: 我们蛰伏在房间里，门关闭着，灯熄灭了。

sentences.english: Black bears are now considered highly efficient hibernators.
sentences.chinese: 此刻，人们以为黑熊是就寝效率最高的蛰伏动物。

sentences.english: Many will die off with the first frost whilst others hibernate until the following spring.
sentences.chinese: 很多会在初霜之时死去，其他的则会蛰伏到来年春天。

sentences.english: Some insects slumber in the winter.
Throughout the winter, warm, such as dormant Maemi, Yaran in the permafrost of the groove back.
sentences.chinese: 整个冬天，热情如蛰伏的鸣蝉，哑然于冻土的沟回。

sentences.english: Between dormant in the distant arctic ice devil, to follow my call to come.
sentences.chinese: 在遥远极寒之处蛰伏的冰雪魔神，顺从我的召唤前来。

sentences.english: We stay in the room, door closed, lights out .
sentences.chinese: 蛰伏在房间里，门关闭着，灯熄灭了。

sentences.english: The pupae remain dormant in the soil until they emerge as adult moths in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 蛹蛰伏在土壤中，直到冬天它们才蜕变成蛾子飞出来。

definition: silence/stillness
hidden beneath the surface/buried and concealed
to occupy illegally/to seize (territory)/to entrench (oneself)
to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
to be fast asleep/(fig.) to lie dormant/to lie undiscovered
to come to/to awaken/to regain consciousness
(of alcohol) to ferment/(of a crisis) to be brewing/to mull over (an issue)/to hold exploratory discussions
to preserve and nurture one's spirit (idiom); honing one's strength for the big push
lit. lay down the flag and still the drums (idiom); fig. to cease/to give in
to hide/to cover up/to conceal
to recover/to recuperate
hibernation
to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
to stir restlessly/to be agitated/commotion/agitation
to struggle on whilst at death's door (idiom)
to take root
